title: 1966 Ferrari 330 GTC Speciale
description: This 1966 Ferrari 330 GTC is the fourth of 598 examples built between 1966 and 1968 and was sold new in July 1966 to Carrozzeria Pininfarina for use as a design study. Chassis 8727 was subsequently modified by the Turin design house with experimental features including "Supervis" pop-up driving lights, hood vents in lieu of fender vents, cloth upholstery, directional dashboard vents, and other aesthetic and functional changes. After the implementation of the design changes, the car was reportedly driven by Sergio Pininfarina before being sold to a Milanese owner in 1967 and passed through two additional Italian stewards before being imported to the US in the 1970s. It was purchased in the 1980s by a pair of California owners who undertook a multi-decade refurbishment that included reinstating the Speciale fog lights before a repaint in the factory shade of Blu Scuro and a re-trim of the interior in tan leather. Following its completion in 2002, the car was sold in 2006 to a collector who retained it until 2023, when it was purchased by the seller. Power is provided by a 4.0-liter Colombo V12 that is topped by triple Weber carburetors and is paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Additional features include servo-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, four-wheel independent suspension, 14” Borrani wire wheels, power windows, and a Becker Grand Prix stereo. This 330 GTC is said to be one of four produced with Speciale features for the 1966 model year and is now offered in Dallas, Texas, with a Marcel Massini report, invoices from current ownership, and a clean Montana title in the seller’s LLC.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1966 Ferrari 330 GTC Speciale at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #183,814.

The Massini report lists features including the blue cloth interior upholstery and the pop-up driving lights as well as the car’s sale to Carrozzeria Pininfarina on July 18, 1966.
